root.name: lightSpecular()
root.description: Sets the specular color for lights. Like fill(), it affects only the elements which are created after it in the code. Specular refers to light which bounces off a surface in a perferred direction (rather than bouncing in all directions like a diffuse light) and is used for creating highlights. The specular quality of a light interacts with the specular material qualities set through the specular() and shininess() functions.

parameter.label: v1
parameter.description: int or float: red or hue value

parameter.label: v2
parameter.description: int or float: green or hue value

parameter.label: v3
parameter.description: int or float: blue or hue value
